DOC.HEADLINE: Summary Box: Renewal of Patriot Act, FBI reform key issues in second term

TEXT.S: Summary Box: Renewal of Patriot Act, FBI reform key issues in second term

JUSTICE DEPARTMENT: Top issues for the U.S. Justice Department in President George W. Bush's second term include persuading Congress to renew key parts of the anti-terrorism Patriot Act and continuing reform of FBI intelligence gathering.
THE OTHER SIDE: Opponents call the Patriot Act's expanded surveillance powers too intrusive and say it was rushed into law after the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks without thorough review in Congress.
OTHER ISSUES: A legal question to be resolved: Can suspected terrorists be tried in civilian federal courts without jeopardizing national security or military missions?
